name: BIOC 100A
title: Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
description: Fundamentals of molecular biology, structure and function of nucleic acids, and protein structure. Designed for students preparing for research careers in biochemistry and molecular biology. Lecture: 3-1/2 hours; discussion: 1-1/4 hours.

conditions.restricted_to_majors: chemistry, biochemistry, and biomolecular engineering and bioinformatics majors, and chemistry minors.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): CHEM 8B; and BIOL 20A. Enrollment is restricted to chemistry, biochemistry, and biomolecular engineering and bioinformatics majors, and chemistry minors.

class_notes: Enrollment in a secondary discussion section is required. If you are a non-Chemistry, Biochemistry, or Biomolecular Engineering and Bioinformatics major who wants to take BIOC 100A, please request enrollment in BIOC 100A with this form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1-4f9Qe3N-kDIRYjx_wWOIfu9PVW75blSbGk_vK67A_Q/edit.
